name: B. Godsend
statement:
Leha somehow found an array consisting of integers. Looking at it, he
came up with a task. Two players play the game on the array. Players
move one by one. The first player can choose for his move a subsegment
of non-zero length with an odd sum of numbers and remove it from the
array, after that the remaining parts are glued together into one array
and the game continues. The second player can choose a subsegment of
non-zero length with an even sum and remove it. Loses the one who can
not make a move. Who will win if both play optimally?
